O1h-Yp_tKOEVb7HQ4WO20Q.text: Great, charming place that holds it's own against other authentic Italian restaurants I've eaten at in Italy and NYC.  The service was spotty but we didn't mind since it was nice not to feel rushed.

mgLDveXh-AbzTk9cfV3saw.text: A long-running local favourite the interiors homely woods are so popular that you'll need to book a table most nights. The rustic-style surrounds are matched by a simple menu featuring high-quality ingredients, best illustrated by the buffet, glistening with all sorts of fresh goodies. Otherwise, expect classic renditions such as of beef carpaccio with pesto and an equally no-nonsense selection of pizzas. With fair prices extending to the all-Italian wine list, Osteria is perfect for when you can't be bothered to cook at home but don't want to eat anything in the high end cuisine. The only problem is that Osteria's popularity makes it very noisy, though friendly staff are adept at keeping the mood upbeat.

ZIyXv3wpVPJHGWgUoIRlSQ.text: This is a sweet, smallish restaurant with a lovely atmosphere, particularly downstairs because it is all low ceilings and low lighting. The food is so good - I went there with my family (8 of us) and our dishes were in constant rotation because everyone wanted to try everyone else's. The only low point of our experience was the waiter - he's the most miserable man I've ever seen. But don't let this put you off - you should definitely go along and try this place in the classy area of Notting Hill. And 10 points if you can make the waiter smile.

eE2Amna-gTaU21eXGANxNw.text: Good atmospher in downstairs room. Good choice of food. A bit pricy though.

q90KQXLqAAbF0CY62Odnxw.text: My fiance took me to have a quaint birthday dinner here. The bread they bring out for you is pretty food - very soft and crusty!  The pastas were also quite good.  He ordered the tagliatelle with a veal ragu and truffle oil, and I had the tortellini filled with spinach and ricotta in a creamy tomato sauce.  Both were great, but I have to admit the truffle oil made his dish - I have a weakness for truffle oil. The tortellini was tasty and sized like big ravioli - that tomato cream sauce was clutch, and the portions were decent as well.  Oh yeah, and to top it off, he had the waiters do the obligatory happy birthday song while they brought out a tiramisu with a candle on it - I covered my face with a napkin until the song was done, but once it was over I went to town on that tiramisu.  Clearly embarrassment has no effect on my appetite.

VxtTncnW-EceHO9RMKlIoQ.text: Authentic, quality Italian food. The interiors though can be quite cramped (and we arrived quite late already in the afternoon). Also, the complimentary bread was a bit too salty though had great elasticity and crunch. Still, it is traditional Italian food fare in nice, rustic surroundings. We tried the pizza osteria and the seafood linguine. These two dishes can feed 2 to 3 people.

mkzxgYhY5QkfygmlX_3fqA.text: Food was delicious but the service made the meal fairly frustrating.  They forgot about both our appetizer and my glass of wine (we weren't charged for either, but the friend that had recommended the place told us to order that particular starter so it was disappointing that we couldn't try it and thank him for the recommendation.)  We intended to order dessert, but after being left alone with the dessert menus for 20 minutes with no one around to take our order, we skipped it and got the check instead.

A2i3u75yT8YMMrebTVGXaA.text: I really wanted to like it here, but honestly I wasn't all that swept away. There's some nice touches, but for the price I think we should have got something a bit better. The tuna I had was lovely, but it wasn't cooked rare like I asked. And honestly, the salad it came with was a little uninspiring. The new potatoes were peeled which was weird. There's not a huge amount of choice on the menu, but this is typical of Italian Trattorias. But, if you don't like veal, you're a bit stuck. I wished I'd gone for the lamb instead, but I do think five veal dishes on a menu is excessive. The wine was lovely, the staff were lovely, my strawberry ice cream was very very lovely indeed (I'd forgotten how much I loved that stuff). But it fell short for me. And I think if someone is paying £18 for a tuna salad, it should be nothing short of outstanding. The whole place could also be made much nicer if they moved one of the tables. I nearly dipped my coat on someone's dinenr we were that close to them. There was a poor couple only two inches away from our table - we weren't being very loud, but it does kinda ruin the romantic atmosphere is you feel like you're on a table of six with complete strangers. I'm still yet to find a wonderful Italian in London. Osteria isn't it

ixO1DI9QKdDRfjX303xdPg.text: I LOVE Osteria Basilico.  It was probably 4 stars a couple of years ago, but as it seems the cooking has gotten even better of late, I can't fault this place.  You can have a rollicking dinner with friends or a romantic meal here as the atmosphere manages to be intimate but fun-loving and civilised but unpretentious.  The food is simple Italian, prepared using the freshest ingredients.  If the weather is warm, sit outside with a thin pizza and a glass of white.  On colder days, snuggle up inside (preferably upstairs: more scenic) and tuck into a veal milanese and some well-priced red.  Or order anything else - you can't go too wrong here.  And the bread... a delightfully warm basket of focaccia...The waiters can be harried at the busiest times but are rarely without charm.

photos.caption: Photo of Osteria Basilico - London, United Kingdom

vf4RwDdeCzwNT93kxXwLrQ.text: This Italian restaurant has a true local feel to it. You see lots of families and some couples, the ambiance is great, and it's a part of the essence of this place. They want you to feel at home. And the food they serve really takes you to a place of comfort. They only use super fresh ingredients, I had the delicious Tortellini with ricotta cheese and fresh basil, and it was superb! They also have a good selection of wines. I recommend you have as a starter the buffet; they serve an assortment of dishes that can calm down a fierce appetite until the pasta arrives.

photos.caption: Photo of Osteria Basilico - London, United Kingdom

5yqecFvFZWq71z6ttbJ7pQ.text: excellent italian restaurant. very friendly staff, nice atmosphere. they could improve the music. if you are going to visit on Saturday night book first. p.s. it's 1130 and they are still serving!

photos.caption: Photo of Osteria Basilico - London, United Kingdom

c2hkwb61Yj2s0nq6UnqPMw.text: Best Calamari ever!!!!! I had ossobucco , or something ...? as a main course.  It was YUMMY! The wine was great, the food was great, the service was great. Make sure to make a reservation, because there is almost always a wait.

ilE4jYDebPJxQEmI4CpeyA.text: I think I must have been a customer at Osteria Basilico for 15 years already  This is a great local place for a simple and savoury lunch or dinner, the food is very good, very tasty and obviously very Italian. Yvan has been managing the place efficiently for so many years and always welcome people with a smile, whether they are the tourists visiting for a day on Saturdays for the market or regulars coming for dinner. I prefer upstairs for the tall windows and the airy atmospher but downstairs is very cosy and great for winter evenings. I used to go with friends when going out in Notting Hill and I now come back with my family and our 2 daughters who love the food, especially the pasta and pizza that they love. In fact, the reason I have been coming at Osteria Basilico for so many years is simple, the food!

nyCdgl0U9crfZDR-_qxhTQ.text: 3.5 stars really.i had a lovely evening here with a gal pal who lives in the area.  she got the rec from a coworker.  we started with a prosciutto platter.  i had the seafood spaghetti, which was packed with mussels, calms and squid.  mmmm!  my friend had the tagliatalle with lamb ragu.  i'm not a lamb fan so i didn't try her's, but she quite liked mine over her's.  i really enjoyed the food, but the service was a bit up and down.  maybe it was because we were sitting outside, but it was hard to flag down waiters.  we had asked for the bill but they brought us dessert menus.  when we politely declined, he seemed miffed that we weren't ordering more.  sorry!  we were stuffed.  food is a good.  service could use some work.

YL2yN3CQ5mXgn-i9rbGuaw.text: I've been eating here regularly for about 16 years and its one of my favorite restuarants. The staff are fantastic I always get a table downstairs  which I much prefer and the food is delicious. A great place for a celebration or a romantic dinner for two. I love it!

v7m_z52LWeHqz5v9lv1PNA.text: So a learned French copaine delivered me to this quaint, rustic restaurant a few years back, when I was an East End skank trying to cultivate an appetite in the well-heeled West. Running parallel to the Portobello Road, I skipped past the Electric in my skinny jeans and polka dotted flats. It was wonderful then, and I certainly wasn't disappointed last night by the food, prosecco or scintillating company, though the triumphant footballing Germans irked me somewhat! The evening: it was all Russian philosophy layered with meaning while the waiters jostled for position, debating where I was from and just why my mother hadn't taught me Italian (the family line). My St. Petersburg date attempted to educate with a spot of light Russian banter. I took mental notes, ready for a grilling. I shouldn't have scoffed the bread with balsamic and olive oil, but I did. The seafood linguine was decadence on a plate, the limoncello to complete the feast was glugged, St. Petersburg claimed it was rather like 'sticky vodka' but I didn't mind much. The bulk of food is currently residing in my fridge ready for consumption. Can you doggy bag it? Yes you can.

94t8DjyfefmN1Y7iv_5AOQ.text: This is an absoluely charming restaurant.  Every good thing said about this restaurant is true.  Whether you are sitting downstairs, where it warm and cozy, on the ground floor where it's bustling and lively, or outside under heat lamps.  You do need a reservation as it's always quite busy.  Everything I've had here has been delicious.  Simple, classic Italian cooking.

iNsK_Iur3GH2TvoW3eiNNA.text: The original notting hill tratoria; pizzas, patas, antipastas and decent wine list. Food is always consistently good. Always full and buzzing with good mix of locals and out of towners. Great for a long weekend lunch and book ahead for dinner.

2jh3sMyWN7mDzve0szYbXw.text: I love this place.  For anyone who wants amazing, authentic Italian without being in a "white tablecloth" fancy establishment.  It's definitely nice, but rustic.  I have been here multiple times, with small groups, dates, and my parents. Everyone always loves it. I usually get the tortellini ricotta spinach because I love the simplicity. It has never disappointed.  It's the only place I've tried Aubergine Parmasan and I get it every time.  Go with an empty stomach - the bread to start is also amazing.

UuQNAY0vDRUUsaq1w0TRBA.text: I love this place! Its packed always and you have to make reservations and if you want to sit upstairs you have to tell them when you make your reservation and not the same day, but once you're in you can't be disappointed. Everything we had was fantastic--the caprese, the clam pasta, the shoulder of lamb and the tuna. The lamb literally fell off the bone and was so tender and when you ate a bite with gravy and mash it was just HEAVEN. The tuna was also delicious and came with a scrummy salad of artichokes, potatoes, olives and green beans on the side. AMAZING! The wine was excellent and the staff were great. Plus I love the atmosphere, the oldish looking wood tables and the candles stuck in empty wine bottles and the fact that it was so lively, full of both couples and groups. This place makes for a great night out.

PINlkl8gZTrOTSV_w8DaGA.text: Consistently brilliant Italian food. They know what they do well and they replicate this year on year. The antipasti delivers always. Restaurants come and go in Notting Hill but OB stays. This is a natural place to lunch in W11 and I've experienced numerous joyous afternoons in it's simple enclave.

F1kz80ywEXfSoFWKZv7EFA.text: During many business trips to London I have unfortunately always struggled to have good meals in London. Using Yelp I found this restaurant on a recent trip, and our meal was amazing! One of the best Italian meals I have ever had. My colleague that has traveled many times to Italy completely agreed. Maybe the best gnocci either one of us have ever had. I will absolutely go back.

-vfYicAplJONbyyjqcUKcg.text: I can't believe I have spent the past two years living so close to this restaurant but have just been there for the first time. Simple place but classic Italian trattoria with a bustling atmosphere - on a Tuesday night we could not get a table there until 9.30pm! Great food, nothing flash but all the Italian classics. I will be back for sure.

AQZtGSn5eLtfBKlNVdcbaA.text: I am from NYC. This place has a cool serve it yourself rustic simple app buffet. Nice home cooked simple but delicious food.

J5_Du_uEHrY7weOqtFbjkQ.text: I am over this place. It is packed on weekends, but on my last visit, despite reservations, we waited a while. Service was not attentive at all, and the food was less than satisfying. For the price, this place needs to be better.

DF3_X59iCc4hc1XA_vfDaQ.text: Excellent Italian food in a two floor setting. Went for early Dinner and was fortunate to be able to get a table - it was busy at 6:30!

6-Pbxf6ukNNiatwRwNdirg.text: The service was great, the foodwas so delicious and the company are remarkable, nothing that you can ask for!I really love this place.The tuna was also deliciouswith delectable salad of artichokes, potatoes, olives and green beans and thewine was superb! Plus I love the ambiance, the whole interiors as well. :)

1m_Y1c2nCka7Ja93Glb3sw.text: Booked this for a special occasion.  Agreed the table we wanted upstairs. When we arrived we were sent downstairs. Although the food was good as we expected, the table was not what we expected and was very cramped. The evening was disappointing. To cap it all we were asked if we wanted to pay the service twice. You can guess the answer.

Jz1w8z1j6L51caJX9p6qfg.text: Really liked it here and even waited for a table (something I hate doing). Sat downstairs for our meal. It was one of the more pleasant below-ground dining areas I've been to - quite cozy with good lighting. All of the food I saw on the tables looked delicious and I heartily enjoyed my pasta dish, as did my friend. Well worth the wait!

XQ1EvORVf_GEkLGUmiKCWA.text: One of the best italian restaurants in London. Authentic dishes and flavors, you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Start with antipasto, then go for a pasta or special of the day. Make a booking because it's always busy for dinner. On a lovely night it's wonderful to dine al fresco. We will really miss this place when we move back to the States - seriously some of the best meals we've had while living here!

NcYgF8O5lU8Z7oiOwPPhKA.text: Recommend by hotel and had a wonderful meal. Restaurant has a good size and fit for business dinner or family party. Delicious pork..

H6A2sPhvNyTei-INB_BIjw.text: Wandering into Notting Hill on a Thursday night without a reservation was a risky venture, and we knew it.  So we were hungry -- and a little impatient -- by the time we found Osteria Basilico.  They were also fully booked, but found us a table outside (and, thoughtfully, blankets, as even with the heaters we were a bit chilly ... nice touch ;-)Food was both reasonable and quite lovely, bread warm and nice, a little wine and we quite forgot the cold.  As some other reviews have noted, the waiters can be a little hard to flag outside -- maybe it's the impatient Americans who always note this, we're so used to the bill hitting the table with the espresso -- but despite the busy service inside and turning a few also-unreserved people away, no one was in a rush to relieve us of our table at all, even when we sort of wanted them to.  ;-)  Lovely find, and we were glad to find it.

n4sAsWg1ew0Vdb5O0TQwkg.text: Great atmosphere with a real italian feel. The prosciutto pizza was simple and excellent. Make sure that you book a table during weekends as it will be packed!

6tpxQs-_DYogQ1jo6W609g.text: This is the best restaurant I have been to in London. Love this place. It was a great evening in Notting HIll and we got a table outside. The service was great, food delicious and company spectacular... not much more you can ask for! :)Delicious grilled  vegetables and squid.. great wine.. and great company :)

rG1n5alS0gC1_rZa69yHlg.text: Delicious!  Carpaccio, Burrata and prosciutto fresh, calamari a bit soggy, main course took forever....45min.  Busy place.  Tried to make reservations by phone for 5 people and was denied.  The took us when we walked in however.  Very Authentic food.

9uMnI7kqwlOygL6rlfGUQQ.text: Very difficult to get a booking but it's worth it when you do.Lovely steak with Rosemary, friendly chatty service and nice ambiance. This is Italy, Notting Hill style...

yNvPMWSYBT_n7NrzhBekSg.text: Just the smoked mozzarella on a bed of mushrooms in tomato sauce and prosciutto is indeed worth the visit. The pizza is good as well, even if not the best that I've had in London. Otherwise, the place looks great and has a very nice, warm feel to it. Quite a lot of Italians eat here often so what better reason would you need for a visit? :)

CiZ4u2IDd8YJN10YJLbYsg.text: One word....GO!!!  This place was phenomenal and I am a southern Italian so I'm pretty picky about my Italian food. The atmosphere, food and the wait staff were all spectacular, I can see why locals love it cause it would be a regular place for me.  The bread is sensational and my companion had the Ossobucco and was close to licking the plate it was that good.  I had a nice tagliatelle bolognese and we both enjoyed our starters.

YgI6CFIcacJagHXILv-7fg.text: Living across the street one would think I would tire of the place. Nope. I eat here at least three times a month and love love love every experience. though I tend to get the same meals as I find myself craving a certain dish (ie: black truffle pasta with homemade tagliatelle and rosemary) for days before giving in, but the service and quality is routine on point and consistently top notch. I prefer to eat upstairs for lunch as the sun shines in (and you can be close to the anti pasta buffet and fill up your plate with grilled aubergine, mozzarella, squid, etc..) and I prefer downstairs for dinner next to the faux fireplace and to be surround by candles in wine bottles. It can be quite pricey when you start with the wine and mains, but pastas are very reasonable. It is definitely worth it. When it comes to Italian outside of Italy, this is as good as it gets.

gZg-0J_LdMvU4HMgYJ3IFA.text: By some cruel twist of fate, my husband is allergic to all shellfish, which means our kitchen is a shellfish-free-zone.Occasionally, my need for shellfish overwhelms every other sensation, and I demand we go someplace for dinner that serves these delightful little crustaceans.  Tonight, that desire collided with the need for Italian, in close proximity to The Gate Cinema.Enter: Osteria Basilico.The spaghetti vongole served at Osteria Basilico rocked my world.  It was perfectly simple, perfectly garlic-y, perfectly buttery, and oh-so sea-salty.  The little suckers were served still in their shells, perfectly cooked and juicy.  And let me say this: they did not skimp in the shellfish department.  There were hundreds of them in there (note: this statement may not be testable or quantitatively accurate).Luckily for both my husband and for me, my need for shellfish has be satiated, at least temporarily.  Equally luckily for both of us, we have now found a tasty Italian restaurant in a delightful little neighbourhood.

ZSGPWEMKX3H7MyCCFH0vKg.text: Outstanding!! The food, service and atmosphere were all wonderful. The meal was fantastic and reasonably priced. I had the burrata and prosciutto special as an appetizer and homemade fettuccine with rosemary and veal ragu as my main course, simply delicious!! Since this bistro is also nestled in hip Notting Hill surrounded by posh shops and bars, I will definitely visit again when I'm back in London! I arrived on the late side of the night and the staff was extremely nice and accommodating. I never felt rushed. It was a fantastic meal and experience!

KcLfO5qJXy13V-cl_yz36w.text: Woooowwwww !!!!!This place is wonderful. Their staff are fantastic. Their wine is great and their antipasti is also very tasty. I got the grilled calamari with rocket lettuce. It was wonderful. i was a bit disappointed about their tiramisu, I had an Italian friend who made tiramisu for our party, Unfortunately Osteria's tirmisu did not keep up to my friends standard ~smile.In short, this is a wonderful place and very hard to get into. So please and reserve ahead. Please be adventerous here ,,, you will not be disappointed. .....

iIJOlF_55wNUDA5aQUruyA.text: While in London for a long weekend, I went for dinner with a good friend I had not seen for a while. She is very happy about the idea of going to Osteria Basilico: one of the favourite places for both of us, among the nicest Italian restaurants in London and for sure in Notting Hill.Located on a parallel street to Portobello Road, Osteria Basilico is a two-storey place with a nice atmosphere and very good quality food.The menu offers a nice variety, and also tends to change over time, which to me is a good sign.Top picks from my last dinner there:- Tortelloni with ricotta and spinach - a classic Italian- Tagliolini 'gamberetti & zucchine'- Chicken breast with avocadoGreat choice of wines - rigorously Italian - out of which we chose a good 2009 Chianti.Staff friendly and mostly Italian.Definitely worth trying, either with your significant one or with a group of friends!

u1qX448j1coraj2KGd_L6Q.text: Delish. The olive oil and soft bread- OMG. The asparagus salad almost made me see God.  Homemade pasta with ragu- yum.  Beautiful macchiato to end it.  Go here.

P1ukDJLiiaz4lPJ8h2uXkQ.text: Had a horrible experience here Friday night.  Had told my friend from out of town about this place and popped in 6.30/7pm to ask about a reservation for that night or another. A man (little with glasses) - I can only assume the owner - was extremely rude.  We didn't even get the chance to talk. He shouted at us from across the entire restaurant, refusing to look at us, then just walked away and started talking to his staff mid my question. Bizarre, rude, arrogant behavior. I was embarrassed I had ever suggested the place to my friend. Will definitely be avoiding in future.Update: just read other reviews here which mention him too.  What a horrible person, ruining people's evening when they come in to enjoy the restaurant.

7LXeLF415eH7jJGgM1Tf-Q.text: I loved my server, I forget his name but he had so much energy and was very funny. He made the whole experience very enjoyable. The pizza we ordered was jut OK but I loved the pasta. They also gave us some limoncello and biscotti for dessert. Great spot for a date night!

t3Ig5M6WNeD2XTew5EiA7A.text: Food pretty decent!! Extremely expensive for what it is.  Cheaper to book a flight to Italy!!And pizza blah, crust weak. Quality just isnt that good. Grilled Calamari is good but tonight it wasn't grilled too much basically felt baked.. should have char and be a bit crispy from grill. Pasta quality not so great. Not sure what kind of flour the are using.There is a little man with glasses! No offense, but he is maybe 4' 11"~ he has zero personality and is horrible .. dies not smile, has no personality no interaction about food  questions  or telling you what is good tonight!  Has ZERO CHARM. He should be washing dishes.. he should not be dealing with customers.  All other waitstaff adorable. However,Everyone walking around  coughing! YuckThe little weird man keeps coming to my table and coughing... he is so gross!He has coughed all over the restaurant like 25 times.Go home! Dont come back ever!  You ruin this sweet little restaurant !! And when you are sick STAY HOME.Plus its winter and its freezing outside and bo door curtain and The dining room freezes every time someone goes in & out!  I had to put my coat on and my dinner got cold.

KgQq-f7ueLtQ-pKOhgRQ_Q.text: Lovely little place in Notting Hill. The staff took care of us despite being a handful of typical Americans... haha. We tried a lot of different things and everything was very tasty. We sat on the ground floor which was really nice because there are large open windows so it feels like you're outside. The sea bass filet was very delicious- almost silky, and the tortellini with spinach and ricotta was definitely creamy and luxurious. Yes I just called pasta luxurious.

photos.caption: Photo of Osteria Basilico - London, United Kingdom. antipasti
Photo of Osteria Basilico - London, United Kingdom. Antipasti mozzarella and ham
Photo of Osteria Basilico - London, United Kingdom. Margherita pizza

r7E3fIYlHsmI9_QI0wyCnw.text: Make sure to get reservation and get a seat upstairs. The downstairs is a little crowded and stuffy. I had dinner with three other people and was a little bit disappointed with the timing of the food. My dish came out about 10 minutes ahead of the others..and not wanting to be rude, I didn't want to begin eating until everyone had their plates. My food ended up being lukecold, but still quite delicious. I ordered the Mezze Maniche con Melanzane, Pomodoro e Mozzarella (Pasta Tubes with Aubergines, Mozzarella Cheese, Basil, and Tomato Sauce) , which is 12.50 euros - not bad at all!!Make sure to finish your meal with tiramisu and limoncello digestif. Delicious.

jeBFiRLbLRkpJjZbCy2bKg.text: Was walking past Portobello Road when I spotted this restaurant on a Saturday afternoon. I knew it had to be good since there was a line coming out the door and the upstairs was completely packed. They seated me and my sister downstairs, right next to a rustic wine cellar. I didn't mind it at all, it was less noisy even though it was just as packed. We had the Pizza Margherita and Tagliolini al Ragout di Manzo. Both were great, but hands down the highlight of our meal was the house-made pasta!

auEHSU9e4J_Emy9nej7Tvw.text: yum yum yum!!! Another spot where I have no clue why I never tried it until recently even though I live so close. The people here are so friendly they went around talking to everyone at each table. We came for lunch and it was packed. From what I could overhear from people trying to get bookings, dinner reservations are much harder to come by.We tried pizza and pasta and both were scrumptious! We can't wait to come back again and try out more of their dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Osteria Basilico - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Osteria Basilico - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Osteria Basilico - London, United Kingdom

6-hXqTdQJQEBvQ-XgdJbkQ.text: The pasta is perfect. Fresh ingredients. Ambience is very pleasant. The olive oil is delicious!

X02zThejNugJ4s8YwoG-ZA.text: I decided to come here grudgingly as it is across the road from my favourite restaurant. However I was best pleased with the outcome. Albeit the prices are expensive it sets the scene for a more intimate/romantic destination. This is definitely a good place for an fun night as part of a planned out evening. The wine is more expensive but they have quite a vast selection which is always nice. My favourite part is the amazing chicken salad (effectively a Caesar salad) which was quite perfect and then the beautifully presented veal escalope which I think is always a safe choice.I would definitely come here again for a definite fun night out. Good staff and great environment. See you there at around 10pm.

uhCCpK0gpeho6nwWDQC9WA.text: I love going to a restaurant after reading a bunch of Yelp reviews and meeting or exceeding expectations.  We had reservations at 9:30 and our table was downstairs.  It felt so homey and loved all the Christmas decorations.  The bread was so good to start especially since we're all so hungry that late.  To start, we decided to share the tuna, aubergine parmagiana (yum! I can eat this as a main!), garlic bread (like pizza), burrata cheese and the white truffle fettucini which was amazing.  For my main I ordered the Tagliolini which definitely was an excellent choice.  For dessert, we ordered 1 tiramisu to share for 6 people as it was pretty big.  Not the best I've had but I'd say good enough.Overall, the food and service was pretty good and would definitely be back for some more cibo.  Ciao bella!!

K6hDdGeBKdk1TPFlGopPmA.text: If you love real Italian food, this is the place for you. The resto is cozy downstairs and trendy upstairs if a bit noisy.Try the Aubergine for starter and the tortellini with ricotta for a main dish. You must stop after each bite to contemplate how delicious the food is.The bread was outstanding and is a meal in itself with good quality olive oil for dipping. The spaghetti with clams was first rate. We finished with good coffee and raspberry cheesecake which was light and creamy.

photos.caption: Photo of Osteria Basilico - London, United Kingdom. Welcoming entrance

VdAcwKtnFsHMqH-w0Kf66Q.text: Authentic Italian in charming Notting Hill. Be surprised with the portion sizes they are very satisfying. Value for money - yes. Service with a smile - by every staff member Authentic Taste - belissimo Italiano. Would I eat here again - in a micro second. The pizza and pasta was fresh, well prepared and tasted as traditional Italian as the decor and staff who wait the floor. Great service, romantic and cosy it's a great place for those who want an up beat dining experience with flavour and flare to boot.A lovely lunch experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Osteria Basilico - London, United Kingdom. 'When the moon hits your eye like a big pizza pie, that's Amore'.

dgAfFmKvccxqzhPj6V8zfQ.text: Came here wanting amazing Italian food and I got exactly what I wanted. This place gets very busy, so make sure you make a reservation or come early. My boyfriend and I got a bottle of wine and 2 pasta dishes that were delicious! I would definitely come back

photos.caption: Photo of Osteria Basilico - London, United Kingdom. Tube pasta with eggplant, mozzarella, and basil in a pomodoro sauce
Photo of Osteria Basilico - London, United Kingdom. This was the linguine with rosemary and veal ragu

r3gq-QViW8CKN_eQqSDQ4w.text: Nice little restaurant. We were there today around 6:45pm and it wasnt really crowned. It seems that there were a lot of reservations but luckily we got a seat without one. I wont say the people are really welcoming tho. And because it is such a small place it was a bit squeezing.The buffet starter was nice. Pay less and can try a lot of different things. Love the mix salad. I ordered the spaghetti with clams and it was delicious.Main courses are actually okay but the starter and drinks were a bit expensive. Two of us spent 75.25 but it was a nice experience. :)

QqvTBzEtI-ma6fTvfJngBw.text: We really enjoyed Osteria Basilico tonight. I'm glad we took this recommendation from the guy sitting next to us at Cecconi's on Saturday. Here's the food rundown: - Burrata with Parma Ham - Excellent - do it. - Tuna Tartare - found the dish to pretty creative incorporating in fruit, avocado and salad - Garlic Bread is actually a garlic bread pizza: wife loves garlic bread and I love anything I can put burrata or tartare on - Tortelloni filled w/ Spinach & Ricotta Cheese: Very good, wish I hadn't filled up on apps so I could have eaten more. Exceptional service. Get upstairs if you can - reserve early. I'd put this on your short list of meals in London if you're seeking out some really good Italian without breaking the bank.

2AbsCcOicZSbcGtCs4Gjvg.text: Great food, great atmosphere and great service! My friend and I made a last minute reservation to come here one day. We got a table downstairs but as it was very hot we asked if we could be moved upstairs. The waiters are all very polite and helpful. They found us a seat up stairs in no time at all. I ordered a starter as I wasnt that hungry of carpaccio. There was a fair bit of meat which was a pleasant surprise. My friend ordered tagliatelle which was yummy and again a fair size portion.We both had ice cream for dessert and it was one of the best ice creams I have ever had. All round a great experience!!

ubWHMAUF4bo2WyB89nJZbw.text: Quite the lovely Italian restaurant located in Notting Hill. I came here with a friend based on his recommendation. We arrived on a weeknight around 8PM and the restaurant was completely full. Luckily we made reservations and got a nice little table for two downstairs.So... the bread. Holy crap, it's absolutely amazing. I had to restrain myself from eating too much. My friend even asked for a second basket. Slightly toasted on the outside with a soft middle. Dip those babies in olive oil and balsamic vinegar and you've got yourself a appetizing treat, as well as a fully blown carbo loaded meal. I ordered the Tagliolini con Gamberetti, Zucchine, Prosciutto Crudo e Pachino (Hand-made Tagliolini with Shrimps, Courgettes ,Parma ham and cherry tomatoes) and loved it. I hate to admit it, but I ate the entire thing in one sitting. *sigh*Kudos to my friend for a picking a superb Italian restaurant! Great food, wonderful atmosphere, and bread that is to die for!

3UhFEueMNEjbeo6T1Svouw.text: Being Italian, I try to avoid Italian restaurants here as most of them are just plain terrible, so when some friends invited me there I was a bit skeptical but went anyways, and thank god I did! This place and their dishes remind me of home, of the things my grandma used to cook! Everything is delicious and they have a great wine selection too (and the staff is actually italian!) it's not as cheap as in Italy but not expensive either, considering the location and quality. Our table was upstairs but when I went downstairs to go to the toilet I noticed that the lower floor was rather noisy. So be aware of that when booking.

3BKCWXlT7v_p2Dgl1dgxkA.text: Oh baby. You have to come here for the smoked mozzarella on a bed of mushrooms in tomato sauce and prosciutto. Just think about that for a moment. Yeah. Come back and finish the rest of this review in a minute. Just come to this restaurant, order this, and don't worry, whenever the grim reaper comes for you, you'll die happy. And you'll float away on a ball of melty, stretchy, smoky cheese. As for what to get after your mozzarella? Well... For the gluten-eater in my life, it's always house-made pasta with an indulgent sauce, which changes with the season and the mood of the chef. I've also had some great anti pasti of the vegetable sort. After you've stuffed yourself on mozzarella, something light like grilled squid can be a welcome idea.Just be sure you call well ahead of time. This place is a destination as well as a local favourite. If you try to show up on a Friday at 8 PM, you'll have to go to one of the copy-cat places nearby. Which is not the end of the world.Gluten-free notes: No problems here. This place is run by Italians and they know what to do. After the cheese-ball of happiness, you can try risotto, grilled fish, or steak. Your life is good.
